thread.title: Comment on Michigan fans attack punter on Twitter after loss by Joey
thread.title_full: Comment on Michigan fans attack punter on Twitter after loss by Joey

author: Joey
title: Comment on Michigan fans attack punter on Twitter after loss by Joey
text:
Posted in Main | 11 Responses 
Talk about a complete reversal! Blake O’Neill quickly went from being the G.O.A.T. to the scapeGOAT with Michigan fans Saturday night. 
Michigan fans upset over the loss to in-state rivals Michigan State, who were praising their punter Blake O’Neill for a amazing 80-yard-bomb in the first quarter, quickly turned into an angry mob on Twitter telling the student-athlete to kill himself and making death threats. 
And we thought the shots at Patrick Towles’ hair were bad… sheesh. 
The spewing of hate towards O’Neill got so bad that Michigan athletic director condemned fans in a open letter Sunday and calling for a ceasefire on the hate against O’Neill. 
“Today I awake to the shocking reality that our community who care so much about this program would send hurtful, spiteful and vicious comments to one of our students.” 
Things started off well enough for O’Neill… 
The drama began when Michigan State stunned everyone with a come-from-behind victory over Michigan on the final play of the game Saturday night. Michigan fans were already celebrating in the stands when O’Neill, a senior from Australia, fumbled the ball which landed in the hands of Michigan State’s sophmore defensive back Jalen Watts-Jackson who quickly dashed 38 yards for a touchdown with no time left. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KpxswFxqxqc 
Open letter from Michigan AD Jim Hackett: 

— Max Cohen (@MaxACohen) October 18, 2015 
Among some of the brutal tweets, fans asked O’Neill to drink bleach, return to Australia and leave the state permanently. 
— Michael® (@stilltheman2010) October 18, 2015 
Some people were quick to defend the punter, including some Michigan State fans: No one complained about the 80 yard punt though. Cowards kick a man while he is down. #BlakeONeill 
Michigan fans just need to hold hands and sing a round of kumbaya. 
Article written by Ricki Barker Writer of things. Watcher of sports. Wearer of blue. Sometimes all at once. 11 responses to “Michigan fans attack punter on Twitter after loss” Kevin C. October 18, 2015 at 3:16 pm | Permalink | Reply 
80 year bomb ?? Leuther October 18, 2015 at 3:16 pm | Permalink | Reply 
The blocked punt in that situation was absolutely inexcusable. O’Neill is responsible and should be held accountable… Priceless October 18, 2015 at 4:13 pm | Permalink 
wish someone could hold you accountable for all of the stupid comments you make. Katya October 18, 2015 at 5:06 pm | Permalink 
You’re a 2/10 troll. At least cats paw tries. Well Done! October 18, 2015 at 5:10 pm | Permalink 
Priceless owned you. Owned You! If you had even an ounce of self-respect, you’d quit posting here. Leuther October 18, 2015 at 5:53 pm | Permalink 
I am extremely unintelligent. I am a douche bag. I am an unclean sphincter muscle of butt most proportion. I am: leuther Why? October 18, 2015 at 7:32 pm | Permalink 
Why’s everybody ganging up on Leuther? In this case, he’s right! cats paw October 18, 2015 at 8:24 pm | Permalink 
Leuther is a dipshit. Everyone knows this. Tommycatsfan October 18, 2015 at 5:20 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Michigan fans now know what it’s like to be a Kentucky football fan. whatwasthat October 18, 2015 at 10:55 pm | Permalink | Reply 
I know loserville trolls spend much more time on UK sites than they do their own, what bunch of crackhead losers. These type of plays is what makes college football the greatest game, shit happens. The cats have been on both ends of plays such as this, but my favorite is, Stevie gets loose against the tards of stripperville. Now beat it losers. Joey October 18, 2015 at 11:29 pm | Permalink | Reply 
Why is the Twitter sphere paying any attention to a self-proclaimed 10 yr old? Post Comment - New and Improved (not really, it just works now)
